vehicle

Class RegularManualTransmission

  • java.lang.Object
    • vehicle.RegularManualTransmission
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ManualTransmission

    public class RegularManualTransmission
extends java.lang.Object
implements ManualTransmission
    This class represents a regular car's manual transmission. This transmission contains 5 gears and increases/decreases to speed are in increments of 1. The speed ranges of the gears are set by the user. This class implements the ManualTransmission interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegularManualTransmission

        public RegularManualTransmission(int l1,
                                 int h1,
                                 int l2,
                                 int h2,
                                 int l3,
                                 int h3,
                                 int l4,
                                 int h4,
                                 int l5,
                                 int h5)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Construct the manual transmission. Input the lower and upper speed ranges of each gear.
        Rules about the speed limits:
        The lower speed limit of gear 1 should be 0.
        Min and max values of gears should increase with increasing gears.
        Only adjacent gears should overlap in their ranges.
        All speeds should be covered between 0 and the maximum speed of gear 5.
        Parameters:
        l1 - Lower speed range of gear 1.
        h1 - Upper speed range of gear 1.
        l2 - Lower speed range of gear 2.
        h2 - Upper speed range of gear 2.
        l3 - Lower speed range of gear 3.
        h3 - Upper speed range of gear 3.
        l4 - Lower speed range of gear 4.
        h4 - Upper speed range of gear 4.
        l5 - Lower speed range of gear 5.
        h5 - Upper speed range of gear 5.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
        Description copied from interface: ManualTransmission
        Returns the status of the transmission. The status describes whether the previous command to change gear or speed was performed successfully.
        Specified by:

      • increaseSpeed

        public RegularManualTransmission increaseSpeed()
        Method to increase speed of the transmission. The lowest speed is 0, and the highest is the highest speed of gear 5 as input by the user. The speed can be increased until the limits of the gears are reached. The status will indicate whether the speed can still be increased, or if you need to increase the gear first. If the maximum speed of the transmissionis reached, the status will indicate this as well.
        Specified by:
        increaseSpeed in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        Returns the transmission with the speed increased by 1 and updates the status.

      • increaseGear

        public RegularManualTransmission increaseGear()
        Increases the gear of the transmission. The gears ranges from 1 to 5. This will also update the status based on whether the command was carried out. The status will indicate whether the speed is too low for the next gear, or whether you have reached the highest gear.
        Specified by:
        increaseGear in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        Returns the transmission with the gear increased by 1 and updates the status.

      • decreaseSpeed

        public RegularManualTransmission decreaseSpeed()
        Method to decreases speed of the transmission. The lowest speed is 0, and the highest is the highest speed of gear 5 as input by the user. The speed can be decreased until the limits of the gears are reached. The status will indicate whether the speed can still be decreased, or if you need to decrease the gear first. If the speed is at 0, the status will indicate the minimum speed is reached.
        Specified by:
        decreaseSpeed in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        Returns the transmission with the speed decreased by 1 and updates the status.

      • decreaseGear

        public RegularManualTransmission decreaseGear()
        Decreases the gear of the transmission. The gears ranges from 1 to 5. This will also update the status based on whether the command was carried out. The status will indicate whether the speed is too high for the next gear, or whether you have reached the lowest gear.
        Specified by:
        decreaseGear in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        Returns the transmission with the gear decreased by 1 and updates the status.
